intro: Cypella amambaica, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, adapted to the cold and dry conditions of its habitat. Cypella amambaica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
